thread.title: Lady Whirlwinds volleyball splits with Conway Blue
thread.title_full: Lady Whirlwinds volleyball splits with Conway Blue

author: Courier sports staff (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Lady Whirlwinds volleyball splits with Conway Blue
text: slideshow The Russellville Lady Whirlwinds volleyball team fell 15-25, 25-23, 9-15 to Conway Blue on Monday.Abby Allen had 10 points, one ace. Kasey Heath had six points. Kate Lane had four points and an ace. Sofia Moreno had three points. Ava Jane McNeill had one kill and two block. Emmie Hipps had two points. Meg Atchison had one kill.The eighth grade team defeated Conway 26-28, 25-10, 15-12.Gracie Black had 10 points, three aces and a kill. Gracie Wells had seven points, two aces and six kills. Ingrid Christensen had six points and two aces. Hannah Vines had three points and two aces. Gracie Palmer had four points. Cindy Gonzalez had three points and an ace. Olivia Barnes had a kill.The eighth grade team also played in the North Little Rock Tournament on Saturday. The Whirlwinds went 6-0 in pool play, but fell in the semifinals to NLR Blue 21-25, 14-25.In that game, Black had two points. Vines had three points an ace and a kill. Cindy Gonzalez had two points and a kill. Palmer had three points and an ace. Wells had three kills.“The girls played really hard and the back roll players, Maddy Howerton, Mattie High and Star Austin had a good day,” RJHS head coach Nina Chiolino said.Russellville will host Mount Saint Mary at 5 p.m. today inside Whirlwind Gymnasium.
